items.content_html: Yay! The bus broke down on its way to my stop this morning. Today was a good day to work from home anyways.

I’m starting the Creative Photography Challenge from CreativeLive. Day 1 was to take a motion blurred shot. I took it at Ash Way Park and Ride in Lynnwood. Thanks to @dh for suggesting the course to me!
I’m looking for a MacBook Pro stand that can work with my older 2014 retina model and my 2017 work-issued TouchBar model. The BookArc möd looks great but they say it doesn’t work that way. Any ideas?

I closed out yesterday by realizing a bunch of work that I’d stashed I had done so without including untracked files, so I lost a bunch when I re-applied the stash. Thus, I start today by re-creating a bunch of work I did yesterday. Hopefully I can do it better this time around.
I finished my Bible in a year plan yesterday, and want to take the next several months and study Isaiah. Does anyone have a good commentary that they can recommend?

I think it would be cool to do a picture a day challenge, it I have no idea what I’d photograph on days when my life feels like the same routine over and over again. How do people find new and interesting things to shoot during the same daily routines?
It was back to work at our historic office today after several days working from home. The commute downtown is kind of a pain but at least I get to work in a place with some great history to it.
I can’t say enough good things about Code Runner. I had to work through a small Python bit of code ad it made things super easy.
I just got a recruiter voicemail that said she was calling “on behalf of my résumé”. I didn’t realize that it needed to get in touch so desperately that it would hire a recruiting agency!
For my birthday, Emily rented a Tesla for us to drive for the day. It’s such a fun car to drive!
